children.subject: Try again. It is open.
I tried enrolling but it says "Consent of department required for enrollment."

Fairly good but nothing is guaranteed. Lower div instructors do their best to accommodate as many people as possible. In the past CS 61C has expanded to accommodate everyone from wait list but that may not happen in F19. Keep in mind that the lower you are on the wait list, the longer you may need to wait for class to expand again. Sometimes people are on wait list until a few days before add/drop.
What are the chances of a Data Science major student?
Same as for any other non-EECS/CS major.
If we're not in one of the above groups, what is our chance of getting off the waitlist after 8/19?
Actually I am declared, but not as CS, would that make a difference?
Yes. If you are declared you will not be enrolled in phase 1. you will have to waitlist and wait until adjustment period
I am still getting waitlisted. I will be an undeclared 3rd year next fall. I should be getting in right?
Enroll in 999 labs and sections
I see that there are discussion and lab times/rooms listed, but we're not able to enroll in them. Will these open up before the class begins?

If you have specific questions about your enrollment, please email cs-enrollments@berkeley.edu and be sure to include your SID number.

I do not expect that W186 will expand but it is still early in enrollment period and that may change. At this time there are no plans to do so.

for 161 and w186, it says there is a reserved seat open, I fulfill the requirement yet i am still placed in waitlist?

also will w186 expand?
Check classes.berkeley.edu for lecture times. You need to speak to professor about time conflicts and finals. Faculty are under NO obligation to accommodate conflicting finals.
would it be acceptable to directly email Professor Garcia regarding this time conflict?
That's the only way to get the information. I cannot speak about alternate finals.
I saw somewhere else that lecture time would be 3-4. I'm assuming it's actually 12-1 MWF? Also, would there be alternative finals for people with final time conflicts?

Not sure if my comment is helpful, but declaring can only be done during 3 specific times a year and takes about a week or more to be processed. So I don’t see how declaring is relevant to enrolling right now

It’s relevant because I was going to Phase 2 this class, at which point in time I was supposed to be declared.  Now, I’m not sure if I should wait. To me there should have only been 2 types of pots, similar to 61B - undeclareds and declared.  I don’t know why there should be this third distinction of LSCS.

In previous times, I would have had no issues getting this class in Phase 2 as a declared.  Now, I’m not so sure.  The last thing I want to do is to get this class for Phase 1 since I’ll never be able to get in my other 3 classes - all 3 have super high waitlists.
So is a L&S rising sophomore declared for CS who started in Fall 2018 considered to be 3 terms and thus eligible to sign up?  Or is it better to hold off on declaring until registered?
This is for CS 61C
You can see that information by looking on classes.berkeley.edu.  Please read the original post above to see what is happening with this class!
Why am I put on the waitlist as an EECS major. Are the EECS reserved seats full?
Please read the original post for this class. I am TEMPORARILY limited in seats until I receive approval from the Dean to expand past classroom capacity.
The class capacity is only 297, how is there 380 seats reserved for EECS? Does that mean, if you make it to the waitlist, you will get in?
Please make it for the MWF 3pm group (Tuesday 7-10pm).   Friday already is CS70 and CS61B, amongst other classes.
Any update on final exam group? Would really help in planning my schedule
I'm looking into it now but it's not my decision to make. Stay tuned.

I think it shouldn't be part of the MWF 3pm group because CS 61C lecture doesn't happen during that group's time. Classes that have different lecture times shouldn't have final conflicts, as makes most sense.
Ah I see, I just checked again after some time and it does show 2 lecture times.

This NOTE is on classes.berkeley.edu now:

The final for this class will be in Exam Group 18 (similar to MWF 12-1P classes)..
So since 61C does allow for time conflicts, if the final for this class conflicts with another class's, is an alternate final exam typically offered?

I've sent Prof. Garcia 2 emails on this topic with no response.  Let us know if you get an answer.

It makes little sense why the Final was scheduled in the MWF 12-1pm group.  EE16A, CS 61B, CS 70 and Math 53 just to name a few all have their Final on that Friday, as well as all English R&C classes.  High likelihood that a number of students will have 3 or more finals that same day.
Which final exam group will CS61C be part of since we now have 2 lecture times?
The system won't allow it. Please read about 999 sections on post @9146 to see how this works.

I am currently enrolled in 999-Dis and 999-lab sections but I see the schedule of discussions and labs are now up on Calcentral. Should I switch to those sections from 999 sections just to ensure our seats? Or would there be other links to enroll in these sections after the semester starts?

From an enrollment system perspective the prerequisites are really just strong recommendations. The system will allow you to enroll in both concurrently.

HOWEVER, I do strongly encourage you to check in with teaching staff at beginning of semester to make sure you're qualified to do well in the class. Give yourself time to drop if you need to before add/drop deadline on 9/18.
Is CS 61B a prerequisite for 61C, or can it be taken concurrently?
I am an undeclared L&S rising sophomore and I'm still on waitlist position 156. Do I have a good chance of being enrolled?

history.content:
IMPORTANT NOTE!

 

Until I get approval from the Dean to exceed room capacity, I'm unable to open ALL the seats for CS 61C. I'm capped by the room size for Li Ka Shing Hall (297 seats).

 

I've allocated some seats in each category of reserve requirement groups and everyone else will be able to wait list. Once I'm able to increase the class size, people on the wait list who meet the requirement groups will be moved into the class. Hopefully that will happen by the end of this week.

 

If you want to view the requirement groups who get priority access to seating, see classes.berkeley.edu and view the RESERVED SEATS section: https://classes.berkeley.edu/content/2019-fall-compsci-61c-001-lec-001

 

By the end of the week, total enrollment is expected to be 950 seats with the following breakdown during phases 1 & 2:

 

EECS/(MSE or NE), or Eng Undec = 380 seats

L& S Undec, 1-5 or Trans 5,6 = 333 seats

Computer Science BA 3+ Terms = 237 seats 

 

These reserves will come down on 8/19 which is the first day of the adjustment period. At that time, the wait list will process students into open seats based on wait list order. If you are NOT in one of the populations listed above and you really want into the class, then you may want to add yourself to the wait list during phase 1 to position yourself well on the wait list. 

 

In the past this class has expanded to accommodate everyone on the wait list but that is no guarantee it will happen during F19. 

 

To enroll, select the lecture AND the 999 and 999A sections.

 

Time conflicts will be allowed for this class. This class will be webcast.
